> 
> KSP seems to freeze sometimes and come up with a dialog box "KSP.exe is not responding". I assume this is a 64-bit issue. Is this a known bug? Log: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/tnvoqbd8k5ucxrt/output_log.txt?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/tnvoqbd8k5ucxrt/output_log.txt?dl=0)

Can't see anything in the log.

What mods do you have installed?

> 
> Can't see anything in the log.
> What mods do you have installed?

[http://i.imgur.com/qjVd3oF.png](http://i.imgur.com/qjVd3oF.png)

Hi! 

I try to ask again being a bit more precise ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

So, I'm triying this procedure with KSP 1.0.4 but:

- First I'm getting quite a lot of messages in red (I can click on close), see here: [https://scontent-lhr3-1.xx.fbcdn.net...18885166_o.jpg](https://scontent-lhr3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xft1/t31.0-8/11838582_10206417514210982_541164931618885166_o.jpg) Here should be a bit more readable: [https://scontent-lhr3-1.xx.fbcdn.net...04312849_o.jpg](https://scontent-lhr3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xtf1/t31.0-8/11223716_10206417521491164_158130329904312849_o.jpg)

- The loading page is missing the progress bar, and it never load the game (I haven't loaded succesfully yet)

- I can see the funny messages changing (adding K to all world, Reaching a safe distance...etc) but... it goes like this... forever.

- I've tried even with **no mods at all** and the loading of the game seems to remain infinitely slow.

- There are no log files, since I'm not getting any error or crash. Just the game remains in "loading screen" but (I repeat) with no progress bar at all, only the funny kerbal phrases.

My PC specs are the following:

OS: Windows 10 Pro 

CPU: Intel Core i7-3770 CPU @3.40GHz (64-bit x64-based processor)

RAM: 8.00 GB RAM

GPU: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 670 

Thanks.

A log will be always created when KSP runs. It is in KSP\_Data > output\_log.

Hello there,

I tried your workaround which work really fine. Thank you!

I'm just sad I had to let go of the Community Tech Tree as it make a little bug when you recover a flight : your spaceport look fully upgraded even if it isn't... I checked by testing Techtree alone on both x32 and x64, the bug only appear on x64 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Anyway it's great to being able to play without looking at your memory usage all the time... Finally... I can enjoy USI + KW Rocketry + Near Future + Interstellar all at once with my alarm, TAC LS and other tools. Just I must avoid the techtree ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Except if you know a workaround.

Kind regards.

> 
> Just I must avoid the techtree ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Except if you know a workaround.

It may take a few tries, but change scenes until it 'downgrades' into the appropriate buildings. You can still use the buildings while they're "fully upgraded" but they cannot be upgraded until you bruteforce the bug to go away for a bit. It's only mildly annoying when you need to upgrade.

> 
> It may take a few tries, but change scenes until it 'downgrades' into the appropriate buildings. You can still use the buildings while they're "fully upgraded" but they cannot be upgraded until you bruteforce the bug to go away for a bit. It's only mildly annoying when you need to upgrade.

Thank you, maybe have you some suggestion of nice add-ons that's work nicely in x64 and I could use, even with unfixer if needed ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) I really like endgame with USI and Interstellar, maybe some good lifters, some fun other things to go with?

I like sometime to play with RemoteTech but sometime it's annoying to start over again to set up a satellite network with a new save...

so is module manager really no longer working correctly with x64 builds?
It appears to be working correctly for me.

Has anyone else had any trouble with the workaround causing Kerbals to become sentient? ...and evil? Just trying to narrow down which mod might be causing this.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/o6MG5jemidA?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Kerbal Polar Expedition 3: [tiny.cc/kpe-3](http://tiny.cc/kpe-3)

For anyone wanting to use this 64 bit community workaround in career mode, but who are unable to workaround the facility upgrade bug there is a workaround: [Custom Barn Kit](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/121100-1-0-x-Custom-Barn-Kit-1-1-1-%28May-27%29-No-instruction-leaflet-edition)

It basically allows you to set the facility values so that you can bypass the upgrade system and start with level 1 facilities that have level 3 attributes, like pre 0.90 career mode.

It's not perfect by any stretch, and I personally like the career 'grind', as some call it, but at least career isn't broken.

It's worth noting that I wasn't having any problems I couldn't solve from within the game until I got all excited and forgot to install mods one at a time and check for this sort of thing..... But with 1.1 supposedly on Win64bit around the corner, I'm not sure I'll bother going through all the hassle of checking which one of the 80+ mods I have currently installed.....

> 
> Has anyone else had any trouble with the workaround causing Kerbals to become sentient? ...and evil? Just trying to narrow down which mod might be causing this.

i have this issue.. looks stock..

EDIT : i know why! -force-opengl makes kerbals like that... DONT USE force opengl

using the win x64 unfixer, it makes far sorta work. mostly. except for the things in the error log, and along with that, the center of lift thing doesent show up. however, when i loaded a previously built far airplane, it flew just fine, with elevons and control surfaces working just fine. even worked with KAS too, but i doubt that has to do with anything.
Do we download Unity editor?

works like a charm, only bug i have found so far, is it will tend to lag in vab and sph when ram usage is above 5GB. other than that, few crashes, and so far, no memory related crashes.(no crashes at all)

Hi Guys,

Tried to give the 64 bit version a go due to a couple of bugs arising in my 32 bit saves. I followed the instructions given which was:

 - Download Unity 4.6.4

 - Install and follow path "Editor/Data/PlaybackEngines/windowsstandalonesupport/Variations/win64\_nondevelopment", copy the "player\_win.exe" to the KSP folder, and rename it "KSP.exe". I named the old file KSP.x32 and the new replacement KSP (And no it isn't named KSP.exe.exe! lol, It just appears as KSP)

 - I then followed the path "Editor/Data/PlaybackEngines/windowsstandalonesupport/Variations/win64\_nondevelopment/Data/Mono" and copied the "mono.dll" into my KSP folder under "KSP\_Data/Mono". I deleted the old mono.dll.

 - I double click on the new KSP.exe and the game boots up normally, however i'm assuming it is still the 32 bit version because there is no indication of it running in 64 bit mode in the bottom right corner.

I have re-traced what I did and re-read the instructions but to no 64 bit avail. I feel as if I am missing something or most likely not followed the instructions carefully enough? Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you in advance.

> 
> I have re-traced what I did and re-read the instructions but to no 64 bit avail. I feel as if I am missing something or most likely not followed the instructions carefully enough? Any help would be greatly appreciated!
> Thank you in advance.

Well, what you did looks right. Do you have Module Manager installed? As long as it's the unfixed version, you should have nyan cat scrolling along the bottom of your loading bar. That lets you know you're running 64-bit KSP.
I have a fresh install so I do not have Module Manager installed. Am I to assume Module Manager is the missing piece?
